trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Beyond the actual workflow or content, businesses have two basic requirements for all applications:
trans-unit.target: Beyond the actual workflow or content, businesses have two basic requirements for all applications:

trans-unit.source: To increase productivity, applications should be easy to discover and access
trans-unit.target: To increase productivity, applications should be easy to discover and access

trans-unit.source: To enable security and governance, the organization needs control and oversight on who can and actually is accessing each application
trans-unit.target: To enable security and governance, the organization needs control and oversight on who can and actually is accessing each application

trans-unit.source: In the word of cloud applications this can best be achieved using identity to control “*WHO is allowed to do WHAT*”.
trans-unit.target: In the word of cloud applications this can best be achieved using identity to control “*WHO is allowed to do WHAT*”.

trans-unit.source: In computing terminology:
trans-unit.target: In computing terminology:

trans-unit.source: *Who* is known as *identity* - a data store that consists of users and groups
trans-unit.target: *Who* is known as *identity* - a data store that consists of users and groups

trans-unit.source: *What* is known as *access management* – management of access to protected resources
trans-unit.target: *What* is known as *access management* – management of access to protected resources

trans-unit.source: Both components together is known as *Identity and Access Management (IAM)*, which is defined by the [Gartner](http://www.gartner.com/it-glossary/identity-and-access-management-iam) group as “*the security discipline that enables the right individuals to access the right resources at the right times for the right reasons*”.
trans-unit.target: Both components together is known as *Identity and Access Management (IAM)*, which is defined by the [Gartner](http://www.gartner.com/it-glossary/identity-and-access-management-iam) group as “*the security discipline that enables the right individuals to access the right resources at the right times for the right reasons*”.

trans-unit.source: Okay, so what’s the problem?
trans-unit.target: Okay, so what’s the problem?

trans-unit.source: If IAM is *not managed* in one place with an integrated solution:
trans-unit.target: If IAM is *not managed* in one place with an integrated solution:

trans-unit.source: Identity administrators have to individually create and update user accounts in all applications separately, a redundant and time consuming activity.
trans-unit.target: Identity administrators have to individually create and update user accounts in all applications separately, a redundant and time consuming activity.

trans-unit.source: Users have to memorize multiple credentials to access the applications they need to work with, especially since they are encouraged not to use the same password for every application for security reasons.
trans-unit.target: Users have to memorize multiple credentials to access the applications they need to work with, especially since they are encouraged not to use the same password for every application for security reasons.

trans-unit.source: As a result, users tend to write down their passwords or use other password management solutions which introduces other data security risks.
trans-unit.target: As a result, users tend to write down their passwords or use other password management solutions which introduces other data security risks.

trans-unit.source: Redundant, time consuming activities reduce the amount of time users and administrators are working on business activities that increase your business’s bottom line.
trans-unit.target: Redundant, time consuming activities reduce the amount of time users and administrators are working on business activities that increase your business’s bottom line.

trans-unit.source: So, what generally prevents organizations from adopting integrated IAM solutions?
trans-unit.target: So, what generally prevents organizations from adopting integrated IAM solutions?

trans-unit.source: Most technical solutions are based on software platforms that need to be deployed and adapted by each organization for their own applications.
trans-unit.target: Most technical solutions are based on software platforms that need to be deployed and adapted by each organization for their own applications.

trans-unit.source: Cloud applications are often adopted at a higher rate than IT organization can integrate with existing IAM solutions.
trans-unit.target: Cloud applications are often adopted at a higher rate than IT organization can integrate with existing IAM solutions.

trans-unit.source: Security and monitoring tooling require additional customization and integration to achieve comprehensive E2E scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Security and monitoring tooling require additional customization and integration to achieve comprehensive E2E scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory (AD) integrated with applications
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory (AD) integrated with applications

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory (AD) is Microsoft’s comprehensive Identity as a Service (IDaaS) solution enabling IAM as a cloud service and providing built in access management, single-sign on (SSO), and reporting [pre-integrated with thousands of applications](https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/active-directory/), including Salesforce, Google Apps, Box, Concur, and lots more.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory (AD) is Microsoft’s comprehensive Identity as a Service (IDaaS) solution enabling IAM as a cloud service and providing built in access management, single-sign on (SSO), and reporting [pre-integrated with thousands of applications](https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/active-directory/), including Salesforce, Google Apps, Box, Concur, and lots more.

trans-unit.source: With Azure AD applications you publish for your partners and customers (business or consumer) will have the same identity and access management capabilities freeing you to focus on you main business.
trans-unit.target: With Azure AD applications you publish for your partners and customers (business or consumer) will have the same identity and access management capabilities freeing you to focus on you main business.

trans-unit.source: The value of Azure AD goes beyond “just” cloud applications.
trans-unit.target: The value of Azure AD goes beyond “just” cloud applications.

trans-unit.source: You can also use it with on-premises applications by providing secure remote access, avoiding the need for VPNs or other traditional remote access management system.
trans-unit.target: You can also use it with on-premises applications by providing secure remote access, avoiding the need for VPNs or other traditional remote access management system.

trans-unit.source: What if you need to implement an application that is not yet listed in the application gallery?
trans-unit.target: What if you need to implement an application that is not yet listed in the application gallery?

trans-unit.source: While this is a bit more time-consuming than configuring SSO for applications from the application gallery, Azure AD provides you with a wizard that helps you with the configuration.
trans-unit.target: While this is a bit more time-consuming than configuring SSO for applications from the application gallery, Azure AD provides you with a wizard that helps you with the configuration.

trans-unit.source: By providing central access management and single sign on (SSO) for all your applications, Azure AD provides the solution to data security and productivity problems.
trans-unit.target: By providing central access management and single sign on (SSO) for all your applications, Azure AD provides the solution to data security and productivity problems.

trans-unit.source: Users can access multiple applications with one sign on giving more time to income generating or business operations activities done.
trans-unit.target: Users can access multiple applications with one sign on giving more time to income generating or business operations activities done.

trans-unit.source: Identity administrators can manage access to applications in one place.
trans-unit.target: Identity administrators can manage access to applications in one place.

trans-unit.source: Integrated application benefits
trans-unit.target: Integrated application benefits

trans-unit.source: The SSO process has two steps:
trans-unit.target: The SSO process has two steps:

trans-unit.source: Authentication, the process of validating the user’s identity.
trans-unit.target: Authentication, the process of validating the user’s identity.

trans-unit.source: Authorization, the decision to enable or block access to a resource with an access policy.
trans-unit.target: Authorization, the decision to enable or block access to a resource with an access policy.

trans-unit.source: When using Azure AD to manage applications and enable SSO:
trans-unit.target: When using Azure AD to manage applications and enable SSO:

trans-unit.source: Authentication is done on the user’s on-premises (e.g. AD) or Azure AD account.
trans-unit.target: Authentication is done on the user’s on-premises (e.g. AD) or Azure AD account.

trans-unit.source: Authorization executes on the Azure AD assignment and protection policy ensuring consistent end user experience and enabling you to add assignment, locations, and MFA conditions on any application, regardless of its internal capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Authorization executes on the Azure AD assignment and protection policy ensuring consistent end user experience and enabling you to add assignment, locations, and MFA conditions on any application, regardless of its internal capabilities.

trans-unit.source: It important to understand that the way the authorization is enacted on the target application varies depending on how the application was integrated with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: It important to understand that the way the authorization is enacted on the target application varies depending on how the application was integrated with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: **Applications pre-integrated by service provider** Like Office 365 and Azure, these are applications built directly on Azure AD and relying on it for their comprehensive identity and access management capabilities.
trans-unit.target: **Applications pre-integrated by service provider** Like Office 365 and Azure, these are applications built directly on Azure AD and relying on it for their comprehensive identity and access management capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Access to these applications is enabled through directory information and token issuance.
trans-unit.target: Access to these applications is enabled through directory information and token issuance.

trans-unit.source: **Applications pre-integrated by Microsoft and custom applications** These are independent cloud applications that rely on an internal application directory and can operate independently of Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: **Applications pre-integrated by Microsoft and custom applications** These are independent cloud applications that rely on an internal application directory and can operate independently of Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Access to these applications is enabled by issuing an application specific credential mapped to an application account.
trans-unit.target: Access to these applications is enabled by issuing an application specific credential mapped to an application account.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the application capabilities, the credential may be a federation token or user-name and password for an account that was previously provisioned in the application.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the application capabilities, the credential may be a federation token or user-name and password for an account that was previously provisioned in the application.

trans-unit.source: **On-premises applications** Applications published through the Azure AD application proxy primarily enabling access to on-premises applications.
trans-unit.target: **On-premises applications** Applications published through the Azure AD application proxy primarily enabling access to on-premises applications.

trans-unit.source: These applications rely on a central on premise directory like Windows Server Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: These applications rely on a central on premise directory like Windows Server Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Access to these applications is enabled by triggering the proxy to deliver the application content to the end user while honoring the on-premises sign-on requirement.
trans-unit.target: Access to these applications is enabled by triggering the proxy to deliver the application content to the end user while honoring the on-premises sign-on requirement.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a user joins your organization, you need to create an account for the user in Azure AD for the primary sign-on operations.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a user joins your organization, you need to create an account for the user in Azure AD for the primary sign-on operations.

trans-unit.source: If this user requires access to a managed application such as Salesforce, you also need to create an account for this user in Salesforce and link it to the Azure account to make SSO work.
trans-unit.target: If this user requires access to a managed application such as Salesforce, you also need to create an account for this user in Salesforce and link it to the Azure account to make SSO work.

trans-unit.source: When the user leaves your organization, it is advisable to delete the Azure AD account and all counterpart accounts in the IAM stores of the applications the user had access to.
trans-unit.target: When the user leaves your organization, it is advisable to delete the Azure AD account and all counterpart accounts in the IAM stores of the applications the user had access to.
